page1: ^March 12th, 1866 - A man came in to see me today, some sort of businessman or whatnot. Claimed to work for that rail company what’s been laying track across the country. Said they’d be reaching us soon enough, asked for my support when the time came. Didn’t see no reason not to. His money’ll spend just nicely.
page2: ^June 23rd, 1866 - Workers started comin’ through, pushed along by the folk they’ve got keepin’ watch over the railroad. They’ve been buildin’ shacks on the outskirts of town, layer after layer. The man I spoke to before came back in, dropped off some more money. Fella smiles a bit too wide.
page3: ^November 7th, 1866 - Company’s been layin’ groundwork for the rail for some time now. Sometimes I get called in to hold up my part of the bargain. Somebody says somethin’ they shouldn’t’ve, sees something they shouldn’t’ve, does somethin’ the company don’t like. I keep things square.
page4: ^April 19th, 1867 - Feels like this whole rail business is gettin’ out of hand. Some suspicious folk started movin’ in, real close-like with the company. They ran Micah out of the church. Haven’t had a sermon in some time now.
^April 19th, 1867, Cont. - And there are those… things. I can’t stand to look at ‘em. But I’m made to. I can only pray that one of them never gets a hold of me the way I seen 'em do to others.
